DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study compare safety effectiveness 1300 mg acetaminophen extend release give three time daily nine day 400 mg ibuprofen give three time daily nine day sign symptom ( Grade I Grade II ) lateral ankle sprain .
DOC.brief_title: A Safety Effectiveness Study Acetaminophen Extended Release ( 3900 mg/Day ) Ibuprofen ( 1200 mg/Day ) Treatment Pain Associated With Ankle Sprains .
DOC.detailed_description: The objective randomized , double-blind , parallel-group study compare safety effectiveness 1300 mg acetaminophen extend release give three time daily nine day 400 mg ibuprofen give three time daily nine day sign symptom Grade I Grade II lateral ankle sprain . The primary efficacy endpoint change baseline ( Day 1 ) Day 4 subject ' pain upon walk . Safety assessment consist monitor adverse event assessment ankle injury course study . Two hypothesis examine use step approach . The first hypothesis acetaminophen extend release inferior ibuprofen relieve pain associate ( Grade I Grade II ) lateral ankle sprain . If acetaminophen extend release inferior ibuprofen relieve pain associate Grade I Grade II lateral ankle sprain , second hypothesis acetaminophen extend release superior ibuprofen relieve pain associate Grade I Grade II lateral ankle sprain . Two acetaminophen 650 mg extend release caplets , take mouth , three time day nine day two ibuprofen 200 mg caplets , take mouth , three time day nine day
DOC.criteria: Have ankle sprain within 24 hour study entry ankle pain walk recently use nonsteroidal , antiinflammatory drug ( NSAIDs ) , pain relieve medication ( include acetaminophen ) medicine could interfere assessment effectiveness female , must pregnant breastfeed Ankle sprain second ankle sprain within six month Both ankle sprain Ankle sprain occur side body knee injury Ankle injury require bed rest , hospitalization , surgical intervention , use nonremovable rigid cylindrical cast Subject report severe severe pain rest fivepoint scale none , mild , moderate , severe severe
